DOC.brief_title: Paraurethral Transplantation Autologous Muscle Derived Stem Cells Treatment Stress Incontinency
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator assess 12-month potential efficacy autologous muscle derive cell therapy stress urinary incontinence . A total 20 woman stress urinary incontinence improve underwent intra-sphincter injection low dose 50Ã—106 autologous muscle derive cell , derive biopsy deltoid muscle . Assessments make 1 , 3 , 6 12 month cell injection . Changes stress urinary incontinence severity evaluate pad test , diary incontinence episode quality life survey .
DOC.criteria: Female Stress Urinary Incontinence symptom Urodynamic stress incontinence confirm multichannel urodynamic test positive cough stress test urgency score < stress score Patient 's age 40 65 year Desire surgical correction stress urinary incontinence inadequate response conservative treatment SUI Postvoid residual volume > 100cc Detrusor overactivity preoperative multichannel urodynamic test History previous synthetic , biologic fascial suburethral sling surgery external genitalia , bladder neck , bladder urethra Desires future childbearing Chronic inguinal vulvar abscess history Hidradenitis Suppurative History bleed diathesis current anticoagulation therapy Inguinal lymphadenopathy inguinal/vulvar mass Current genitourinary fistula urethral diverticulum Current sever cystocele rectocele Active urinary infection Nontreated urge incontinency significant void dysfunction Neuromuscular disorder Uncontrolled Diabetes Reversible cause incontinence ( i.e . drug effect ) Contraindications surgery
